result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tomas Norkus

defendant.name: Norkus, Tomas
defendant.address: 116 East Chateau Place, Whitefish Bay, WI 53217

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint DPA Discharge Summary.  Filed, sdg.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Jonathan Carver Smith in court via telephone.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense is not aware of Defendant's whereabouts.  Court notes Defendant's failure to comply with the terms of his DPA.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.
JusticePoint DPA Non-compliance Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Tomas Norkus in court with attorney Susan Marie Roth.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp on behalf of Deann Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. State placed negotiations on the record. Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement. 
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.


Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  
Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  
Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jonathan Carver Smith in court.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp on behalf of Deann Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Defendant not in court. Defense counsel advised the Court the defendant is at work and believed the court date was scheduled for 11/3/15. Court granted defense request and ordered a bench warrant to be issued but stayed until tomorrow morning. Parties will be prepared to proceed with the plea at that time. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tomas Norkus in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp on behalf of Deann Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. The defendant has completed the assessment with Justice Point. Defense requested one additional court date pending the results of the assessment. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tomas Norkus in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Parties are still in negotiations and anticipate a resolution in this matter. Defendant is awaiting a decision on admission into drug treatment court. Court granted joint request for an additional adjournment in this matter. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tomas Norkus in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the State. Defense is attempting to have the defendant evaluated for drug treatment court and requested a projected plea date. Court admonished the defendant for arriving late to court. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tomas Norkus in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Court ordered case continued for scheduling conference before Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with VA Transportation.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Tomas Norkus in court with attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Arraignment scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Court ordered case adjourned for Arraignment in Branch 20.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Tomas Norkus not in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 3/13/15 @ 1:30 pm
